page.title: 18FARMING:ARABLE
page.content: The farms Heathley, Lodge and Hill were originaly seperate farms, but now have merged to create larger fields and so increase the profits made on arable crops. Major crops are wheat, barley, with some land used for potatoes and oil seed rape. There is also a small herd of cattle bred for market. These farms possess many items of farm machinery eg. combine harvester, several tractors. Fields are large. The soil contains much clay, making it difficult to work. The 3 farms cover an area of 400 acres.Many of the older buildings are being replaced by larger, modern buildings. The farms appear very profitable. Mr. Lockhart (Heathley Farm) was interviewed: he likes the area and does not wish to move. He mentioned a good communal spirit; farmers help each other when necessary.
